intro: Cyrtanthera macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered sand orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and are borne on slender stems. Cyrtanthera macrantha is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and distinctive member of its ecosystem.
